description: Also known as the Philippine Cockatoo, this is a critically endangered species. It is an all-white cockatoo with a helmet-like crest and distinctive reddish-orange feathers under the tail.
temperament: Intelligent, social, and playful. Due to their rarity, most are in conservation programs rather than the pet trade. They require significant social interaction.
loudness: Loud. They have a loud, raucous call typical of cockatoos.
vocalization: Can learn to talk, but their numbers are so low that their primary vocalizations are their natural calls.
dietaryNeeds: A varied diet including seeds, fruits, flowers, and nuts. Their specific dietary needs are a focus of conservation breeding efforts.
healthPointers: Lifespan of up to 40 years. Critically endangered due to habitat loss and poaching. They are not available as pets.
housing: Housed in specialized aviaries for breeding and conservation purposes. Not a pet species.
